intro: Silene cucubalus var. breviflora, commonly known as the short-flowered catchfly, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its upright, branched stems and small, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. Its flowers are usually less than 1 cm in length, giving it its common name. Silene cucubalus var. breviflora is often found in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to temperate climates.
